CatDescriptText: Article accompanying related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 17, 1958, pg. A19, reads: "Marlene Burleigh Brown Is Now Mrs. James G. Moore - Marlene Burleigh Brown and James Gilbert Moore were married in solemn and lovely rites performed at the Hayes School of Music by the Rev. Clarence A. Burrell. The lovely bride chose a gown of coral chiffon, with matching fingertip veil, for her important day.  Made of honor was Barbara Ann Nelson of Cleveland, Ohio.  Herbert Wilks was best man.  The bride's small daughter Toni, was flower girl for her mother.  Soloist was David C. Johnson, and the organist was the bride's aunt, Marie Carter Hayes.  The bride is the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William C. Burleigh Jr.  The groom is the son of Mr. and Mrs. John Moore.  Stunning senior aides included Mmes. Roberts, Z. Harvey, Evelyn Benson, May Smith, Marion Holmes and Virginia Rickmond.  Charming junior aides were Mmes. Bernice Alston, Barbara Nelson and Edna Anderson.  The happy pair will be at home after May 15 at 7796 Alsance [Alsace] St."
TitMainTitle: Groom James Gilbert Moore wearing dark rimmed eyeglasses and light colored dinner jacket, and bride Marlene Burleigh Brown Moore wearing coral chiffon dress with ruched bodice, seated in front of plants in Hayes Music School
